name: ClinicalImpression
title: ClinicalImpression
description: A record of a clinical assessment performed to determine what problem(s) may affect the patient and before planning the treatments or management strategies that are best to manage a patient's condition.

elements.name: ClinicalImpression
elements.description: A record of a clinical assessment performed to determine what problem(s) may affect the patient.

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: Business identifiers assigned to this clinical impression by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

elements.name: status
elements.description: Identifies the workflow status of the assessment.

elements.name: statusReason
elements.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the ClinicalImpression.

elements.name: code
elements.description: Categorizes the type of clinical assessment performed.

elements.name: description
elements.description: A summary of the context and/or cause of the assessment - why / where it was performed, and what patient events/status prompted it.

elements.name: subject
elements.description: The patient or group of individuals assessed as part of this record.

elements.name: encounter
elements.description: The Encounter during which this ClinicalImpression was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

elements.name: effectiveDateTime
elements.description: The point in time or period over which the subject was assessed.

elements.name: effectivePeriod
elements.description: The point in time or period over which the subject was assessed.

elements.name: date
elements.description: Indicates when the documentation of the assessment was complete.

elements.name: assessor
elements.description: The clinician performing the assessment.

elements.name: previous
elements.description: A reference to the last assessment that was conducted on this patient. Assessments are often/usually ongoing in nature; a care provider (practitioner or team) will make new assessments on an ongoing basis as new data arises or the patient's conditions change.

elements.name: problem
elements.description: A list of the relevant problems/conditions for a patient.

elements.name: investigation
elements.description: One or more sets of investigations (signs, symptoms, etc.). The actual grouping of investigations varies greatly depending on the type and context of the assessment.

elements.name: protocol
elements.description: Reference to a specific published clinical protocol that was followed during this assessment, and/or that provides evidence in support of the diagnosis.

elements.name: summary
elements.description: A text summary of the investigations and the diagnosis.

elements.name: finding
elements.description: Specific findings or diagnoses that were considered likely or relevant to ongoing treatment.

elements.name: prognosisCodeableConcept
elements.description: Estimate of likely outcome.

elements.name: prognosisReference
elements.description: RiskAssessment expressing likely outcome.

elements.name: supportingInfo
elements.description: Information supporting the clinical impression.

elements.name: note
elements.description: Commentary about the impression, typically recorded after the impression itself was made, though supplemental notes by the original author could also appear.
